info.title: Retool API
info.description: Go to Settings > API to get started. Once you generate an API token, use bearer token authentication to make requests.

id.description: The id of the user

legacy_id.description: The legacy id of the user

active.description: Whether the user is active or not

first_name.description: The first name of the user

last_name.description: The last name of the user

is_admin.description: Whether the user is an admin or not

two_factor_auth_enabled.description: Whether two factor authentication is enabled for this user

universal_resource_access.description: The universal resource access level for the group. This denotes the access level that this group has for all resources.

universal_workflow_access.description: The universal workflow access level for the group. This denotes the access level that this group has for all workflows.

universal_query_library_access.description: Level of access that the group has to the Query Library.

landing_page_app_id.description: The app ID of the landing page

group.description: This object represents a permission group. A permission group is a list of users by which to restrict access. You add users to one or more groups and then configure the group's level of access. This applies the same permissions to all group members. See https://docs.retool.com/org-users/concepts/permission-groups or more information.

is_system_folder.description: Whether the folder is a system folder

folder.description: This object represents app, resource and workflows folders.

space.description: This object represents a space. Spaces can be used to separate your organization's data.

source_control_configuration.description: This object represents the Source Control provider configuration for the organization or space. See [docs](https://docs.retool.com/source-control) for more information.

auto_branch_naming_enabled.description: When enabled, Retool automatically suggests a branch name on branch creation. Defaults to true.

custom_pull_request_template_enabled.description: When enabled, Retool will use the template specified to create pull requests. Defaults to false.

custom_pull_request_template.description: Pull requests created from Retool will use the template specified.

version_control_locked.description: When set to true, creates a read-only instance of Retool, where app editing is disabled. Defaults to false.

force_uuid_mapping.description: When set to true, creates a uuid mapping for protected elements to be used in the source control repo. Defaults to false.

auto_cleanup_branches_enabled.description: When set to true, Retool will automatically delete branches after changes are merged if the remote branch no longer exists and there are no uncommitted changes. Defaults to true.

name.description: The name of the app theme.

created_at.description: Date and time when the app theme was created.

updated_at.description: Date and time when the app theme was last updated.

app_theme.description: This object represents an app theme. App themes allow you to customize the look of your app. See https://docs.retool.com/apps/web/concepts/themes for more information.

id.description: The app ID.

is_module.description: Whether the App is a module

is_mobile_app.description: Whether the App is a mobile app

release_version.description: The live release version of the app. 'latest' if releases are disabled or the app has no live release yet

sso_configuration.description: This object represents the SSO configuration for an organization or space. See [docs](https://docs.retool.com/sso) for more information.

disable_converting_queries_to_prepared_s.description: This allows you to use Javascript to dynamically generate SQL but also turns off SQL injection protection.

show_write_gui_only.description: This allows you to enable writing via only the restrictive GUI query editor.

use_dynamic_database_names.description: Enable this to allow the Database Name to be overridden by a dynamically generated value. This allows using Retool with a database that has been sharded into several different databases.

use_dynamic_database_hosts.description: Enable this to allow the Database Host to be overridden by a dynamically generated value. This allows using Retool with several different databases.

convert_mysql_dates_to_javascript.description: This allows you to turn your MySQL date strings into Javascript Date objects.

extra_body_values.description: Extra body values are not passed for GET or HEAD requests.

cookies_to_forward.description: You can use the pattern COOKIE_your_cookie_name in the Headers section in order to implement the double-cookie submit pattern.

forward_all_cookies.description: This is useful if you have dynamic cookie names.

authentication_options.description: Note that custom auth is not yet supported.

name.description: How the library will be referred to in Toolscript, and other code based usages.

label.description: How the library will be referred to in the Retool UI. Should be human readable.

id.description: The ID of the configuration variable

name.description: The name of the configuration variable

description.description: The description of the configuration variable

secret.description: Whether the configuration variable is a secret

value.description: The value of the configuration variable

id.description: The id of the configuration.

provider.description: This is an enumerated field that can only take the value "Sentry". It identifies the provider of the observability configuration.

dsn.description: This is a string field that represents the Data Source Name (DSN). It is the unique identifier that helps Sentry know where to send errors and exceptions.

ca_certs.description: This is an optional array of Certificate Authority (CA) certificates. These are passed as `caCerts` to Sentry's NodeClient

provider.description: This is an enumerated field that can only take the value "Datadog". It identifies the provider of the observability configuration.

api_key.description: This is a string field that represents the API key for Datadog. This key is used to authenticate with the Datadog API.

site.description: This is a enumerated field that represents the Datadog site which the organization wants to send logs to. The default value is US1 which corresponds to the default website datadoghq.com.

config.description: Provider-specific configuration. For Datadog, provide an API key. For Sentry, provide a DSN.

enabled.description: When enabled, use this provider for apps observability monitoring.

observability_configuration.description: Shape of external Observability provider config

usage_analytics_organization.description: An organization in the context of usage analytics

count_current_page_saves.description: The number of page saves for all the organizations within the date range

count_current_page_views.description: The number of page views for all the organizations within the date range

count_current_users.description: The total number of unique users who have performed any tracked activity in all the organizations within the date range

count_T30_users.description: The number of unique users who have been active over the trailing 30 days from the end date provided

percent_growth_page_saves.description: The percentage growth in page saves compared to the previous cycle of the same length as the provided date range

percent_growth_page_views.description: The percentage growth in page views compared to the previous cycle of the same length as the provided date range

percent_growth_users.description: The percentage growth in unique users compared to the previous cycle of the same length as the provided date range

percent_growth_T30_users.description: The percentage growth in T30 users (trailing 30 days users) compared to the previous cycle of the same length as the provided date range

maa.description: The number of distinct applications that were active on the given day

mau.description: The number of distinct users who were active on the given day

count_viewers.description: The number of viewers of the app in the time range specified

count_editors.description: The number of editors of the app in the time range specified

schema.description: Maximum number of items to return per page. If not provided, all items are returned. When provided, enables pagination and the response will include next_token for retrieving subsequent pages. Valid range: 1-100.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return per page. If not provided, all items are returned. When provided, enables pagination and the response will include next_token for retrieving subsequent pages. Valid range: 1-100.

schema.description: Cursor token for retrieving the next page of results. Obtained from the next_token field of a previous paginated response. Only valid when the limit parameter is also provided.

parameters.name: next_token
parameters.description: Cursor token for retrieving the next page of results. Obtained from the next_token field of a previous paginated response. Only valid when the limit parameter is also provided.

data.description: Created or updated Source Control Provider Config

delete.description: Deletes source control provider configuration for organization or space. The API token must have the "Source Control > Write" scope.

get.description: Tests the connection to the source control provider. Returns a boolean for whether the connection was successful or not. The API token must have the "Source Control > Read" scope.

post.description: Attempts a test deployment (no permanent changes) using the provided commit SHA in order to determine whether the commit is valid. The API token must have the "Source Control > Test Deploy" scope.

commit_sha.description: The full commit SHA to dry deploy

200.description: Returns success or failure with the deployment logs.

post.description: Deploys the latest changes from the source control provider to the instance. You can use the GET /deployment/{id} endpoint to check the status of the deployment. The API token must have the "Source Control > Deploy" scope.

200.description: The deployment id of the triggered deployment.

id.description: The deployment ID

commit_sha.description: The commit SHA that was deployed. Will be null while the deployment is in PENDING_START status.

triggered_by.description: The user ID who triggered the deployment, or null if triggered automatically

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the deployment was created

completed_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the deployment completed, or null if still in progress

get.description: Get the status of a deployment. The API token must have the "Source Control > Deploy" scope.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The deployment ID

id.description: The deployment ID

commit_sha.description: The commit SHA that was deployed. Will be null while the deployment is in PENDING_START status.

triggered_by.description: The user ID who triggered the deployment, or null if triggered automatically

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the deployment was created

completed_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the deployment completed, or null if still in progress

get.description: Returns a list of source control deployments in reverse chronological order. This returns the same data as shown in the deploy dashboard. The API token must have the "Source Control > Deploy" scope.

id.description: The deployment ID

commit_sha.description: The commit SHA that was deployed. Will be null while the deployment is in PENDING_START status.

triggered_by.description: The user ID who triggered the deployment, or null if triggered automatically

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the deployment was created

completed_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the deployment completed, or null if still in progress

deployments.description: List of deployments, ordered by creation time (most recent first)

get.description: Returns the source control settings for the organization or space. The API token must have the "Source Control > Read" scope.

200.description: Source control settings for the organization or space.

auto_branch_naming_enabled.description: When enabled, Retool automatically suggests a branch name on branch creation. Defaults to true.

custom_pull_request_template_enabled.description: When enabled, Retool will use the template specified to create pull requests. Defaults to false.

custom_pull_request_template.description: Pull requests created from Retool will use the template specified.

version_control_locked.description: When set to true, creates a read-only instance of Retool, where app editing is disabled. Defaults to false.

force_uuid_mapping.description: When set to true, creates a uuid mapping for protected elements to be used in the source control repo. Defaults to false.

auto_cleanup_branches_enabled.description: When set to true, Retool will automatically delete branches after changes are merged if the remote branch no longer exists and there are no uncommitted changes. Defaults to true.

get.description: Returns a list of organizations that the token has scope to access. The API token must have the 'usage' scope. 'usage:organization' scope returns just the organization, 'usage:spaces' returns all the spaces under the admin organization, 'usage:license' returns all the organizations that use that license key. If you self-host Retool, you must set the `USAGE_API_TOKEN` environment variable to use this endpoint.  Follow [our guide on enabling usage analytics for self-hosted Retool](https://docs.retool.com/org-users/guides/monitoring/usage-analytics#enable-usage-analytics-for-self-hosted-retool).

get.description: Returns the organization's advanced settings. The API token must have the "Organizations > Read" scope.

id.description: The id of the organization.

request_access_enabled.description: Whether users can request access to join the organization.

ai_support_bot_disabled.description: Whether the AI support bot is disabled.

release_management_enabled.description: Whether versions and releases on apps are disabled.

apply_preloaded_css_to_homepage.description: Whether preloaded CSS is applied to the Retool homepage.

preloaded_css.description: Custom CSS rules to apply across Retool.

preloaded_javascript.description: Preloaded JavaScript that will apply to every Retool app.

javascript_links.description: List of custom JavaScript libraries to load in every app.

workflow_run_retention_period_mins.description: Number of minutes to store workflow run history data (up to a max of 90 days on cloud, 1 year on-prem)

app_owners_permissions_management.description: Whether app owners can manage permissions for their apps directly.

two_factor_auth_required.description: Whether two-factor authentication is required for all users in the organization.

two_factor_auth_type.description: Required 2FA type, applies to the whole organization

disable_new_login_ip_notification_email.description: Whether notification emails for logins from new IPs are disabled.

data.description: This object represents the advanced settings configured on an organization.

two_factor_auth_required.description: Whether two-factor authentication is required for all users in the organization.
